name: Aadhaar Update Portal Phishing
description: Scammer impersonates UIDAI (Aadhaar authority) sending urgent notices about Aadhaar deactivation, directing victims to a fake government portal to steal personal identity information and biometric data.

turns.scammer_message: UIDAI NOTICE: Your Aadhaar card is about to be deactivated due to incomplete biometric update. Complete verification within 48 hours to avoid deactivation.
turns.notes: Initial government impersonation scare tactic about Aadhaar deactivation.

turns.scammer_message: Dear Citizen, as per UIDAI mandate dated 15-Jan-2026, all Aadhaar holders must complete biometric re-verification. Visit the official update portal to verify your identity: http://aadhaar-update-portal.gov.in.fake/verify. Failure to comply will result in Aadhaar suspension.
turns.notes: Scammer shares fake government portal link with .gov.in in subdomain to appear legitimate.

turns.scammer_message: If you are facing issues with the online portal, you can also complete your Aadhaar biometric update by calling our UIDAI helpdesk at +91-9911002233. Our trained officers will guide you through the process step by step. Service available Mon-Sat, 9 AM to 6 PM.
turns.notes: Scammer provides fake helpdesk phone number to add credibility and alternate attack vector.

turns.scammer_message: REMINDER: Only 24 hours remaining for your Aadhaar verification. Non-compliance may affect your PAN card linkage, bank accounts, and government subsidies. Complete now at http://aadhaar-update-portal.gov.in.fake/verify or email uidai.updates@govhelp.in for assistance.
turns.notes: Scammer resends phishing link and shares fake email, threatening impact on other services.

turns.scammer_message: URGENT: Your Aadhaar number ending in XXXX is flagged for deactivation in 6 hours. This will block your LPG subsidy, bank withdrawals, and SIM card verification. Call +91-9911002233 immediately to resolve or write to uidai.updates@govhelp.in for expedited processing.
turns.notes: Scammer repeats phone number and email with escalated threats about essential services.

turns.scammer_message: FINAL NOTICE from UIDAI: Aadhaar deactivation will be processed in 1 hour. After deactivation, re-enrollment requires visiting an Aadhaar Seva Kendra with original documents, which may take 30-45 days. Verify now: http://aadhaar-update-portal.gov.in.fake/verify to avoid this hassle.
turns.notes: Final extreme urgency with phishing link, threatening lengthy re-enrollment process.
